title: Adani group stocks plunge as U.S. SEC looks to question founder over fraud charges
summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is seeking permission to send summons to Gautam Adani and two others over fraud and bribery charges.

title: India Turns to Atlantic and Middle Eastern Crude as Russian Supplies Falter
summary: Indian Oil Corp. has bought several crude oil cargos from Angola, Brazil, and the UAE to replace Russian barrels under sanctions, Reuters reported today, citing unnamed sources. title: Shell Considers Asset Sales in Argentina’s Shale Heartland
summary: Shell may be considering leaving the Vaca Muerta shale play in Argentina, Reuters has reported, citing unnamed sources. Both a partial asset sale and a full exit are on the table, according to the report, with the deal or deals potentially fetching billions. The Vaca Muerta play is considered the s…

title: Traceable gold brand targets growth after deal with net zero mine
summary: Initiative wants to move beyond niche volumes and attract more jewellers

title: Venezuela’s lawmakers back oil sector reforms
summary: Legislation that could reach final approval next week allows foreign and local private companies to commercialise oilfields

title: Why Colombia Is Redesigning Its Natural Gas Network
summary: As domestic onshore supply continues to decline, higher LNG imports are a must for the country, and after 2031, it could have the option to produce offshore gas from Sirius, pending its FID. With the alternatives in hand, the Caribbean coast will increasingly anchor gas supply, reinforcing coast-to…

title: U.S. Reopens Venezuela’s Oil Spigot, but Refuses to Guarantee Security
summary: U.S. officials told oil executives on Wednesday that Washington will not provide security guarantees for companies operating in Venezuela, even as the Trump administration encourages the industry to re-engage with the country’s oil sector. title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX lines up four banks for blockbuster IPO
summary: Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley set to take lead on listing

title: New $2.5 Billion Agency Will Boost U.S. Critical Mineral Production
summary: A bipartisan group of lawmakers has proposed creating a new $2.5 billion agency to accelerate U.S. production of rare earths and other critical minerals, according to AP and MSN.
